mainBoard.flavorText: No matter where you find them, goblins love rocks.

mainBoard.originalText:
First strike
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: The least popular goblins get the outer caves.
mainBoard.name: Clickslither
mainBoard.originalText:
Haste
Sacrifice a Goblin: Clickslither gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
mainBoard.text:
Haste
Sacrifice a Goblin: Clickslither gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Legends say a djinn gave the goblins a gift they could never hope to master.
mainBoard.name: Emberwilde Augur
mainBoard.originalText: Sacrifice Emberwilde Augur: Emberwilde Augur deals 3 damage to target player. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice Emberwilde Augur: It deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker. Activate only during your upkeep.

mainBoard.flavorText: Inside even the humblest goblin lurks the potential for far greater things—and far worse.
mainBoard.name: Flamewave Invoker
mainBoard.originalText: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player.
mainBoard.text: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.

mainBoard.name: Gempalm Incinerator
mainBoard.originalText:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins in play.

rulings.text: The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (because, for example, it has been countered, or all of its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve, and you'll draw a card.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
You can cycle this card even if there are no legal targets for the triggered ability.

mainBoard.text:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.

mainBoard.flavorText: Akki shells provided good protection when downhill charging became headlong tumbling.
mainBoard.name: Goblin Cohort
mainBoard.originalText: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've played a creature spell this turn.
mainBoard.text: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: There's always room for one more.
mainBoard.name: Goblin Matron
mainBoard.originalText: When Goblin Matron comes into play, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

If an effect refers to a “[subtype] spell” or “[subtype] card,” it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, Goblin War Party is a card that references and creates Goblins, but it isn't a Goblin card.

mainBoard.text: When Goblin Matron enters, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

mainBoard.name: Goblin Ringleader
mainBoard.originalText:
Haste
When Goblin Ringleader comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: If an effect refers to a “[subtype] spell” or “[subtype] card,” it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, Goblin Gathering is a card that creates Goblins and features Goblins in its illustration, but it isn’t a Goblin card.

mainBoard.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
When Goblin Ringleader enters, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Let's play 'sled.' Here's how it works: you're the sled."
mainBoard.name: Goblin Sledder
mainBoard.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.
mainBoard.name: Goblin Warchief
mainBoard.originalText:
Goblin spells you play cost {1} less to play.
Goblin creatures you control have haste.

rulings.text: Goblin Warchief’s effect reduces only generic mana in the cost of Goblin spells you cast. For example, it doesn’t reduce the cost of Skirk Prospector below {R}.

mainBoard.text:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblins you control have haste.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Everybody but me—CHARGE!"
mainBoard.name: Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
mainBoard.originalText:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.
Sacrifice two Mountains: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play.

rulings.text: If you don’t actually sacrifice the Goblin (because it was removed from the battlefield before the ability resolved, for example), no damage is dealt.

mainBoard.text:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.
Sacrifice two Mountains: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

mainBoard.flavorText: "I got it! I got it! I—"
mainBoard.name: Mogg Fanatic
mainBoard.originalText: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: Once Mogg Fanatic has dealt and been dealt combat damage, it’s too late to activate its ability before it’s destroyed.

mainBoard.text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: It deals 1 damage to any target.

mainBoard.name: Mogg War Marshal
mainBoard.originalText:
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Mogg War Marshal comes into play or is put into a graveyard from play, put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token into play.
mainBoard.text:
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Mogg War Marshal enters or dies, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.
mainBoard.name: Mudbutton Torchrunner
mainBoard.originalText: When Mudbutton Torchrunner is put into a graveyard from play, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
mainBoard.text: When Mudbutton Torchrunner dies, it deals 3 damage to any target.

mainBoard.flavorText: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
mainBoard.name: Raging Goblin
mainBoard.originalText: Haste
mainBoard.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "Release chaos with me!"
mainBoard.name: Reckless One
mainBoard.originalText:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins in play.
mainBoard.text:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins on the battlefield.

mainBoard.name: Siege-Gang Commander
mainBoard.originalText:
When Siege-Gang Commander comes into play, put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Siege-Gang Commander's activated ability, including Siege-Gang Commander itself.

mainBoard.text:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters, create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to any target.

mainBoard.flavorText: "I order you to volunteer."
mainBoard.name: Skirk Drill Sergeant
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin is put into a graveyard from play, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it into play. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
mainBoard.text: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin dies, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

mainBoard.flavorText: He's boss because he's smart enough to get out of the way.
mainBoard.name: Skirk Fire Marshal
mainBoard.originalText:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: It can tap itself but is not required to do so.
Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.

mainBoard.text:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I like goblins. They make funny little popping sounds when they die."
—Braids, dementia summoner
mainBoard.name: Skirk Prospector
mainBoard.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Skirk Prospector’s activated ability, including Skirk Prospector itself. Note that once you sacrifice Skirk Prospector, you won’t be able to activate its ability again, so if you’d like to sacrifice multiple Goblins including Skirk Prospector for mana, be sure to sacrifice Skirk Prospector last.

mainBoard.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R}.

mainBoard.flavorText: In a shaman's grimy hands, a concoction of dried Skirk Ridge herbs can become the face of panic.
mainBoard.name: Skirk Shaman
mainBoard.originalText: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.
mainBoard.text: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Auntie Grub had caught a goat, a bleating doe that still squirmed in her arms. At the same time, her warren decided to share with her a sensory greeting of hot tar . . . ."
—A tale of Auntie Grub
mainBoard.name: Tar Pitcher
mainBoard.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
mainBoard.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to any target.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Within each of you is the strength of a landslide."
—Kumano, to his pupils
mainBoard.name: Spitting Earth
mainBoard.originalText: Spitting Earth deals damage equal to the number of Mountains you control to target creature.
mainBoard.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: Boggarts revel in discovering new sensations, from the texture of an otter pellet to the squeak of a dying warren mate.
mainBoard.name: Boggart Shenanigans
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever another Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from play, you may have Boggart Shenanigans deal 1 damage to target player.

rulings.text: Kindred is a card type that allows noncreature cards to have creature types. For example, Echoes of Eternity is an Eldrazi (although not a creature) while on the battlefield and an Eldrazi card (although not a creature card) in zones other than the battlefield.
This cards was originally printed with the "tribal" card type. That card type has been replaced with "kindred". This change does not affect the gameplay function of this card.
While it appears only on cards that already have other card types, kindred is a card type and will be counted by effects that refer to the number of card types among cards in a zone.

mainBoard.text: Whenever another Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may have Boggart Shenanigans deal 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.

mainBoard.text:

mainBoard.flavorText:
"After Auntie brushed the soot from her eyes, she discovered something wonderful: the fire had turned the goat into something that smelled delicious."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

rulings.text: Kindred is a card type that allows noncreature cards to have creature types. For example, Echoes of Eternity is an Eldrazi (although not a creature) while on the battlefield and an Eldrazi card (although not a creature card) in zones other than the battlefield.
This cards was originally printed with the "tribal" card type. That card type has been replaced with "kindred". This change does not affect the gameplay function of this card.
While it appears only on cards that already have other card types, kindred is a card type and will be counted by effects that refer to the number of card types among cards in a zone.
